question.Title: In my django admin change_list, there are names with diacritics. How to order them properly?
question.Body:
I'm using it with Python 3.6.5. In my Django 2.1 app, I have a model object like this:

class Person(models.Model):    name = models.CharField(max_length=64)

with some names presenting diacritics. In my admin.py, I have:

from django.contrib import adminfrom .models import Personclass PersonAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):    ordering = ['name']admin.site.register(Person, PersonAdmin)

So, this is the default order I got when accessing my change_list admin view:

JosephJosuéJoséÉderson

but I need them to show up in this order:

ÉdersonJosephJoséJosué

Also, I have a sort key to do this trick when I have a list:

import localedef sort_key_BR():    locale.setlocale(locale.LC_ALL, "pt_BR.UTF-8")    return locale.strxfrmnames = ['Joseph', 'Josué', 'José', 'Éderson']names.sort(key=sort_key_BR())for n in names:    print(n) # Éderson Joseph José Josué

Worth to mention, in my project's settings.py, I already have:

LANGUAGE_CODE = 'pt-BR'

What is the proper way to inform a sort key rather than the default to ordering in Django models? Rather what is a proper way of doing this?

answer.Body:
I advise you to use an other filed with autofill and put away "é" and other stuff : 

class Person(models.Model):    name = models.CharField(max_length=64)    url = models.CharField(max_length=64)    def save(self, *args, **kwargs):        self.url = self.name.replace("é", "e").lower()        super(Person, self).save(*args, **kwargs)

And then in admin.py:

from django.contrib import adminfrom .models import Personclass PersonAdmin(admin.ModelAdmin):    ordering = ['url']admin.site.register(Person, PersonAdmin)
